essential.yAxisLabel: Marriage rate for males per thousand
feedback: Not quite. In 1957 there were 2 women getting divorced for every 1,000 married women.
Pretty close. In 1957 there were 2 women getting divorced for every 1,000 married women.
Too high - in 1957 there were 2 women getting divorced for every 1,000 married women.
appendText:
Throughout the 20th century the divorce rate rose steadily, helped along by the Divorce Reform Act 1969 which allowed couples to divorce without either partner having to prove the other was at fault. Since 2003, however, it has been in decline: this could be because of couples marrying later, and choosing to live together instead of get married.

After a peak in the early 1970s (when people were getting married at a younger age than before), marriage rates have fallen steadily as the average age of brides and grooms has increased and couples opt to live together instead of getting married.
